stateWideResources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona
stateWideResources.description: 2-1-1 Arizona is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals and families to over 8,500 local and statewide resources. The service helps people find assistance with basic needs, housing, utilities, food, healthcare, employment, and other essential services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Dial 2-1-1 within Arizona | 877-211-8661 from anywhere | Fax: 602-263-0979 | Arizona Relay: 7-1-1 or 800-367-8939 | Address: 1275 W. Washington St. Suite 210, Tempe, AZ 85288
stateWideResources.eligibility: All Arizona residents
stateWideResources.notes: Available by phone from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday through Friday. Website search available 24/7. Cannot help people in person at their office.

stateWideResources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona
stateWideResources.description: 2-1-1 Arizona is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals and families to over 8,500 local and statewide resources. The service helps people find assistance with basic needs, housing, utilities, food, healthcare, employment, and other essential services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Dial 2-1-1 within Arizona | 877-211-8661 from anywhere | Fax: 602-263-0979 | Arizona Relay: 7-1-1 or 800-367-8939 | Address: 1275 W. Washington St. Suite 210, Tempe, AZ 85288
stateWideResources.eligibility: All Arizona residents
stateWideResources.notes: Available by phone from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday through Friday. Website search available 24/7. Cannot help people in person at their office.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline provides support, information, and referrals about sexual and domestic violence as well as assistance navigating the legal system. The helpline offers multiple contact methods including phone, chat, SMS, and email.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone affected by sexual or domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Hours: Monday 8:30-5, Tuesday 8:30-7, Wednesday 8:30-5, Thursday 8:30-5, Friday 8:30-5. Additional 24-hour hotlines are available through partner organizations.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Attorney General Resources for Seniors
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of resources for seniors in Arizona, providing information on elder abuse reporting, care facilities, legal services, business licensing, and agencies offering programs for seniors.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Office of the Arizona Attorney General: (602) 542-2124 | Email: seniorabuse@azag.gov | Adult Protective Services Hotline: (877) 767-2385 | Area Agency on Aging - 24 hour Senior HELPLINE: (602) 264-4357
stateWideResources.eligibility: Seniors and their caregivers or family members
stateWideResources.notes: Resources include information on reporting elder abuse, evaluating senior living facilities, legal assistance, business licensing verification, and connections to various state and national agencies providing senior services. The office also offers community engagement presentations on senior-related issues.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Attorney General Resources for Seniors
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of resources for seniors in Arizona, providing information on elder abuse reporting, care facilities, legal services, business licensing, and agencies offering programs for seniors.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Office of the Arizona Attorney General: (602) 542-2124 | Email: seniorabuse@azag.gov | Adult Protective Services Hotline: (877) 767-2385 | Area Agency on Aging - 24 hour Senior HELPLINE: (602) 264-4357
stateWideResources.eligibility: Seniors and their caregivers or family members
stateWideResources.notes: Resources include information on reporting elder abuse, evaluating senior living facilities, legal assistance, business licensing verification, and connections to various state and national agencies providing senior services. The office also offers community engagement presentations on senior-related issues.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Child Care Resource & Referral (CCR&R)
stateWideResources.description: Arizona Child Care Resource & Referral provides resources and support for families with young children, including help finding quality child care, parenting resources, and connections to early childhood development programs. The organization serves as a hub connecting families to various support services across Arizona.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona families with children, particularly those with children from birth to age 5
stateWideResources.notes: Offers connections to multiple featured organizations including Birth Through 5, Candelen, Child & Family Resources, Inc., Child Care Aware, First Things First, and Read On Arizona. Services include child care search assistance and educational resources.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services - Resources
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Veterans' Services provides a comprehensive directory of resources for veterans, including information on benefits, services, and support programs. The department connects veterans with various resources including crisis support, employment assistance, healthcare services, and educational opportunities.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Combat Call Center: 877-WAR-VETS (877-927-8387) | Veterans Crisis Line: 800-273-8255 | Website: https://dvs.az.gov/resources
stateWideResources.eligibility: Veterans, service members, and their families in Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Offers resources in multiple categories including suicide prevention, women veterans services, employment assistance, and educational benefits. Also provides access to the Military Family Relief Fund and other veteran-specific programs.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services - Resources
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Veterans' Services provides a comprehensive directory of resources for veterans, including information on benefits, services, and support programs. The department connects veterans with various resources including crisis support, employment assistance, healthcare services, and educational opportunities.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Combat Call Center: 877-WAR-VETS (877-927-8387) | Veterans Crisis Line: 800-273-8255 | Website: https://dvs.az.gov/resources

stateWideResources.notes: Offers resources in multiple categories including suicide prevention, women veterans services, employment assistance, and educational benefits. Also provides access to the Military Family Relief Fund and other veteran-specific programs.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Statewide Independent Living Council (AZSILC)
stateWideResources.description: A 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation that facilitates systemic changes to promote equality, inclusion, and choice for people with disabilities. Works strategically to strengthen and enhance the delivery of Independent Living programs, services, and concepts across Arizona.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: 10720 W. Indian School Rd, Ste 19 #1006, Phoenix, AZ 85037 | Phone: (602) 262-2900 | Fax: (602) 271-4100
stateWideResources.eligibility: Does not provide direct services to individuals; serves as a coordinating body for independent living resources across Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: AZSILC promotes resources, opportunities, and experiences which empower people with disabilities to live independently. They gather public input and cultivate relationships and partnerships to maximize outcomes for people with disabilities.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Child Safety Youth Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of resources for youth currently in or formerly in foster care, providing support for education, housing, advocacy, and successful transition to adulthood.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Email: YouthServices@azdcs.gov | Youth Empowerment Council: DCSYEC@azdcs.gov
stateWideResources.eligibility: Young people currently experiencing foster care, as well as youth who formerly experienced foster care (especially ages 16-21)
stateWideResources.notes: Resources include advocacy services through DCS Youth Advocates, Youth Empowerment Council participation, community-based housing options, financial literacy support, and connections to various helplines and community organizations. The program also provides information on resolving complaints, understanding foster youth rights, and accessing community-based support for employment, healthy relationships, and LGBTQ resources.
stateWideResources.languageSupport: English, additional languages may be available through specific programs

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Child Safety Youth Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of resources for youth currently in or formerly in foster care, providing support for education, housing, advocacy, and successful transition to adulthood.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Email: YouthServices@azdcs.gov | Youth Empowerment Council: DCSYEC@azdcs.gov

stateWideResources.notes: Resources include advocacy services through DCS Youth Advocates, Youth Empowerment Council participation, community-based housing options, financial literacy support, and connections to various helplines and community organizations. stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Community Resources
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides a comprehensive directory of community resources for low-income families, including assistance programs for food, housing, healthcare, employment, and other basic needs. The directory includes links to various state and federal programs as well as nonprofit organizations.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents seeking assistance with basic needs
stateWideResources.notes: The DES Community Resources page contains links to external websites that provide various types of assistance. Users can download the Arizona Resource List or filter resources by category to find specific types of help.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Community Resources
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides a comprehensive directory of community resources for low-income families, including assistance programs for food, housing, healthcare, employment, and other basic needs. stateWideResources.name: DisabilityResources.org - Arizona Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of disability services and resources in Arizona, covering employment services, independent living services, rehabilitation services, and more for individuals with disabilities.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals with disabilities in Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: The directory includes information about various organizations providing services in different categories: employment services (RISE Services, What Can You Do Campaign), independent living services (AZSILC, Ability360, ASSIST to Independence), rehabilitation services (Arizona Rehabilitation Services Administration, Disability Rights Arizona), and more.

stateWideResources.name: DisabilityResources.org - Arizona Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of disability services and resources in Arizona, covering employment services, independent living services, rehabilitation services, and more for individuals with disabilities.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals with disabilities in Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: The directory includes information about various organizations providing services in different categories: employment services (RISE Services, What Can You Do Campaign), independent living services (AZSILC, Ability360, ASSIST to Independence), rehabilitation services (Arizona Rehabilitation Services Administration, Disability Rights Arizona), and more.

stateWideResources.name: DisabilityResources.org - Arizona Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of disability services and resources in Arizona, covering employment services, independent living services, rehabilitation services, and more for individuals with disabilities.

stateWideResources.notes: The directory includes information about various organizations providing services in different categories: employment services (RISE Services, What Can You Do Campaign), independent living services (AZSILC, Ability360, ASSIST to Independence), rehabilitation services (Arizona Rehabilitation Services Administration, Disability Rights Arizona), and more.

stateWideResources.name: Disability Rights Arizona
stateWideResources.description: The protection and advocacy agency for Arizonans with disabilities. A non-profit public interest law firm dedicated to protecting the rights of individuals with a wide range of physical, mental, psychiatric, sensory and cognitive disabilities.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phoenix Office: 5025 E. Washington St., Suite 202, Phoenix, AZ 85034 | Phone: (602) 274-6287 | Toll Free: (800) 927-2260 | Email: center@disabilityrightsaz.org
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals with disabilities in Arizona whose legal rights have been violated or who have experienced abuse or neglect
stateWideResources.serviceArea: State-wide (Arizona) with offices in Phoenix and Tucson
stateWideResources.notes: Follows an intake process to determine if a case meets criteria for services. Provides self-advocacy resources, legal representation, and education on disability rights. Does not create attorney-client relationships through initial contact.

stateWideResources.name: Disability Toolkit - Resources in Arizona
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive toolkit created by Jewish Family & Children's Services (JFCS) and Gesher Disability Resources that provides information and expectations for families with a disabled child or adult who find themselves having to care for a person and don't know what to do.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Jewish Family and Children's Services (JFCS) and Gesher Disability Resources (Gesher)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone living in Arizona caring for a person with disabilities
stateWideResources.notes: The toolkit addresses frequently asked questions including: what questions to ask, who to call, ALTCS/DDD options, medical services, educational alternatives, vocational rehabilitation, residential options, Social Security, ABLE accounts, and finding advocates/navigators.

stateWideResources.name: Disability Toolkit - Resources in Arizona
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive toolkit created by Jewish Family & Children's Services (JFCS) and Gesher Disability Resources that provides information and expectations for families with a disabled child or adult who find themselves having to care for a person and don't know what to do.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Jewish Family and Children's Services (JFCS) and Gesher Disability Resources (Gesher)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone living in Arizona caring for a person with disabilities
stateWideResources.notes: The toolkit addresses frequently asked questions including: what questions to ask, who to call, ALTCS/DDD options, medical services, educational alternatives, vocational rehabilitation, residential options, Social Security, ABLE accounts, and finding advocates/navigators.

stateWideResources.name: LGBTQIA+ Resources & Support - Autism Society of Greater Phoenix
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of LGBTQ+ resources in Phoenix and Arizona, with a focus on supporting individuals who are both autistic and LGBTQ+. Includes information on local organizations, support groups, and community services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: LGBTQ+ individuals in Phoenix and Arizona, with specific resources for those who are both autistic and LGBTQ+
stateWideResources.notes: Features multiple local resources including Phoenix Pride, Equality Arizona, GLSEN-Arizona, LGBTQ Awareness Group of AZ, and one-n-ten youth services. Also provides access to the LGBTQIA+ Arizona Resource Guide created by Arizona Coalition to End Sexual Violence's Rainbow Collective.

stateWideResources.name: LGBTQIA+ Resources & Support - Autism Society of Greater Phoenix
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of LGBTQ+ resources in Phoenix and Arizona, with a focus on supporting individuals who are both autistic and LGBTQ+. Includes information on local organizations, support groups, and community services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: LGBTQ+ individuals in Phoenix and Arizona, with specific resources for those who are both autistic and LGBTQ+

stateWideResources.name: Money Fit Low-Income Resources in Arizona
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of low-income assistance resources in Arizona, organized into four categories: Food, Housing/Utilities, Child/Family Care, and Healthcare, with detailed information about each program.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Low-income residents of Arizona; specific eligibility requirements vary by program
stateWideResources.notes: The directory includes resources for nutrition assistance, housing support, healthcare services, and family assistance programs. Each resource includes a brief description, contact information such as phone numbers and website URLs. Money Fit also offers debt management services and financial education resources.

stateWideResources.name: Olmstead Rights - Arizona Disability Resources and Advocacy Organizations
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of disability resources and advocacy organizations in Arizona, categorized by service type and providing links to government agencies and disability rights organizations.
stateWideResources.eligibility: People with disabilities in Arizona and their caregivers
stateWideResources.notes: Includes information on Protection & Advocacy Organizations, Aging and Disability Resource Centers, Legal Services Organizations, Independent Living Councils, Crisis Services, Developmental Disabilities Services, Mental Health Services, Physical Disabilities Services, and more specialized resources.

stateWideResources.name: one·n·ten
stateWideResources.description: A nonprofit organization dedicated to serving and assisting LGBTQ+ youth and young adults ages 11-24. Provides empowering social and service programs that promote self-expression, self-acceptance, leadership development, and healthy life choices.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Downtown Youth Center in Phoenix | Website: https://onenten.org/
stateWideResources.eligibility: LGBTQ+ youth and young adults ages 11-24
stateWideResources.serviceArea: State-wide (Arizona) with locations in Phoenix, Flagstaff, Yuma, and other cities
stateWideResources.notes: Offers various programs including youth welcome meetings, social activities, leadership development, and safe spaces for LGBTQ+ youth to connect with peers. Also operates POND Housing for LGBTQ+ youth experiencing homelessness.

stateWideResources.name: one·n·ten
stateWideResources.description: A nonprofit organization dedicated to serving and assisting LGBTQ+ youth and young adults ages 11-24. Provides empowering social and service programs that promote self-expression, self-acceptance, leadership development, and healthy life choices.

stateWideResources.notes: Offers various programs including youth welcome meetings, social activities, leadership development, and safe spaces for LGBTQ+ youth to connect with peers. Also operates POND Housing for LGBTQ+ youth experiencing homelessness.

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline Local Resources
stateWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of resources for teens and families available throughout Arizona, covering topics including suicide/crisis intervention, general counseling, sexuality, runaway support, abuse/sexual assault, and pregnancy/STD services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Teenagers and their families
stateWideResources.notes: Teen Lifeline offers a crisis line where teens can talk to trained peer counselors (ages 15-19) from 3pm-9pm daily, and to adult counselors at other times. The website provides an extensive directory of local resources organized by category, including hotlines, support services, and specialized programs for various teen issues.

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline Local Resources

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV) provides resources and support for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault throughout Arizona. Their helpline connects survivors with appropriate services, and they offer crisis intervention, safety planning, and referrals to local resources.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV) provides resources and support for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault throughout Arizona. Their helpline connects survivors with appropriate services, and they offer crisis intervention, safety planning, and referrals to local resources.

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline
stateWideResources.description: Teen Lifeline provides a safe, confidential, and crucial crisis service where teens help teens make healthy decisions. Their hotline is answered by trained peer counselors (teens 15-19) from 3pm-9pm daily, with adult counselors available during other hours. They offer crisis intervention, suicide prevention, and connections to local resources for youth throughout Arizona.

stateWideResources.name: Catholic Charities
stateWideResources.description: Catholic Charities provides homeless services throughout Arizona, offering emergency shelter, transitional housing, and permanent supportive housing. They work to help individuals and families experiencing homelessness find safe, stable, and affordable housing with supportive services.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition that provides support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate a 24/7 helpline and connect survivors with local services.
stateWideResources.phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline)
stateWideResources.hours: 24/7 helpline; Office hours by appointment only
services: Connection to local domestic violence programs
stateWideResources.eligibility: Victims of sexual and domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.application_process: Call helpline or contact through website

stateWideResources.description: State agency providing various assistance programs

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: A state agency that coordinates homeless services through federal and state funds, contracting with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing a housing crisis in Arizona
stateWideResources.application_process: Call 211 or visit the 2-1-1 Arizona website to obtain assistance with locating shelter, affordable housing, and limited rent and utility assistance

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS)
stateWideResources.description: Arizona's Medicaid agency that offers health care programs to serve Arizona residents. They provide resources for locating substance abuse treatment and opioid services throughout the state, including in Pinal County.
stateWideResources.phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County)
stateWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Crisis services available 24/7
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents; some services available regardless of insurance status
stateWideResources.application_process: Varies by service; contact through website or call appropriate regional number
stateWideResources.service_area: Arizona statewide, with specific services for Pinal County residents

stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with not for profit and local government entities to provide homeless services throughout Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Services include Rapid Rehousing, Emergency Shelter, Homeless Prevention, and Street Outreach.

countyWideResources.contactInfo: 3049 Sycamore Ave., Kingman, AZ 86409 | Phone: 928-757-1535 | Email: cornerstonemissionaz@yahoo.com
